info.title: Verteil Direct Connect (VDC) Air APIs
info.description: VDC Post booking API version 3 based on NDC 21.x

post.description: The service used to reprice the existing Order before making payment in deferred payment flow

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
The OrderReshop transaction set passes new shopping requests to an airline to replace existing specified order or order items in an Order or for new shopping requests to add to an existing Order. Airline responds with product offers within the context of the existing Order.
There is no change to the Order or Order Items, in response to a Reshop request - typically, the Reshop response will be followed by an OrderChangeRQ or OrderCancelRQ transaction, to commit the re-shop offer.
In the response, the Airline can provide exact instructions as to what actions can finally be executed, as a solution to the initially requested action.

parameters.name: ThirdpartyId
parameters.description: IATA-defined 2-character code of the carrier owning the offer/order

parameters.name: Service
parameters.description: NDC service name

parameters.name: Resource
parameters.description: NDC service sub function and version

post.description:
The service used by the seller to request the airline to commit changes to an existing Order
by adding, removing or replacing Order Items (with potential refund conditions, in case of cancellations).
The actions possible are determined by the airline and communicated to the seller via `OrderReshop` and `OrderRequote`
APIs (which precedes `UpdateOrderItems`). It is up to the seller to then accept the proposed actions from the
`OrderRequoteRS` by echoing these functions in this order servicing structure.
The updated view of the Order is returned.

post.description:
Request used by the seller to request the airline to split the PNR by deleting passengers from the parent PNR.
This is preceded by OrderRetrieveRQ and the passenger reference IDs to be deleted are sent to this request
along with passenger details.
The updated view of the Order is returned.

post.description:
The service used by seller to accept a change as advised by the airline on an event of involuntary schedule change
This request is preceded by the OCN notification which is sent by the airline during a involuntary change
and the seller is expected to respond with an option provided by them.
The updated view of the Order is returned.

post.description:
The service used by the seller to request the airline to commit changes to an existing passenger
This change includes name change. The request includes the previous name (given/surname/title name) and the new name (given/surname/title name) to which name of passenger should be changed
The response is OrderViewRS with name changed.

IndividualGenderCode.description:
Enumeration set for Gender Code.
 {codeListAgencyName}ICAO{/codeListAgencyName}
 {codeListName}Document 9303 Sex of the holder{/codeListName}
 - UNSPECIFIED: Default unspecified
 - F: Female
 - M: Male
 - U: Unknown

PaymentCardTrxPaymentCardCardProductType.description:
Optional. Represents card product type.
P-personal or C-Commercial
 - X: Default value : Unknown card type
 - P: Personal
 - C: Commercial

PaymentCardTrxPaymentCardCreditCardVendo.description:
A two-letter code assigned according to IATA Resolution 728. Example: VI for Visa
 - AX: American Express
 - DS: Discover Card
 - DC: Diners Club
 - UP: China UnionPay
 - JC: Japan Credit Bureau
 - CA: Mastercard
 - TP: Universal Air Travel Plan (UATP)
 - VI: VISA International

RemarkRemarkType.description:
Enumeration of types of remarks
 - PUBLIC: Remark will be displayed and shared with airlines and other suppliers
 - INTERNAL: Remark will be displayed but will not be shared with airlines or any suppliers

RestrictionsChangeTypeCode.description:
Enumeration of change type codes
--TODO: Validate values
 - CHANGE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default unspecified
 - NAME: Pax name change
 - FLIGHT: Flight change
 - SERVICE: Service change

SeatProfileSeatCharacteristicCode.description:
Enumeration of seat characteristic codes according to PADIS code list 9825.

 - SEAT_CHARACTERISTIC_UNSPECIFIED: Default unspecified
 - A: Aisle seat
 - B: Seat with bassinet facility
 - C: Crew seat
 - D: No seat - exit door
 - E: Exit and emergency exit seat

-- Todo: Add others

SecurePaymentVersion2CardNumberCollectio.description:
Indicates the collection method of the card number.
This will be newly entered or using previously saved information.

 - COLLECTION_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value : Unknown collection method
 - K: Keyed entry
 - S: Previously stored

SecurePaymentVersion2PayerAuthentication.description:
Used to identify an exemption to performing payer authentication.
Default value : ND (None defined)
 - ND: Default value : None Defined
 - AO: Authentication Outage
 - DA: Delegated Authentication
 - LV: Low Value Exemption
 - MA: Merchant Problem and Major Outage
 - SC: Secure Corporate Exemption
 - TB: Trusted Beneficiary Exemption
 - TR: Transaction Risk Analysis Exemption

Used to identify possible pre defined reasons for failure to complete payer authentication.

 - FAILURE_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: Failure code not specified
 - NC: Authentication Not Complete
 - NS: Authentication Not Successful

SecurePaymentVersion2PaymentTrxChannelCo.description:
Indicates the payment transaction channel.

 - TXN_CHANNEL_UNSPECIFIED: Not specified
 - EC: Electronic commerce
 - FA: Face to face
 - MO: Mail order (paper mail, fax and email)
 - TO: Telephone order/ IVR

ServiceEnumsRFIC.description:
Enumeration of service categories. Most of these correspond to IATA Reason For Issuance Codes (RFIC) - refer to PADIS Codeset for data element 4183 - Special Condition.

 - A: Air transportation
 - B: Surface Transportation /Non Air Services
 - C: Baggage
 - D: Financial Impact
 - E: Airport services
 - F: Merchandise
 - G: Inflight services
 - H: Reserved for future ATPCO use
 - I: Individual Airline Use

SortSortParameter.description:
Enumeration of parameters that influence sort order of shopping results
 - SORT_PARAMETER_UNSPECIFIED: Default. Results will be sorted based on Price
 - PRICE: Default. Sort based on total Offer price
 - STOPS: Sort based on the number of stops
 - DEPARTURE_TIME: Sort based on departure time of first flight segment

commonApplicableParty.description:
Enumeration of application modes of an amount or restriction (e.g. baggage allowance)
 - PER_PAX: Applicable individually to each passenger
 - PARTY: Application combined to all passengers in a party

type.description: Required. Type of Baggage Allowance. E.g. Checked or CarryOn.

descText.description: Optional. Baggage Allowance description and additional information.

weightAllowances.description: Optional. Baggage weight allowance with application information.

pieceAllowances.description: Optional. Defines the maximum number of each allowable baggage type.

dimensionAllowances.description: Optional. Baggage dimension allowance with application information.

commonBaggageAllowance.description:
The amount of checked or carry-on luggage the airline will allow.
--TODO: Will we always provide at least one of WeightAllowance, PieceAllowance or DimensionAllowance

commonBaggageAllowanceType.description: Enumeration of types of Baggage Allowances. E.g. Checked or CarryOn.

commonBaggageDimensionCategory.description:
Enumeration of baggage dimension categories
 - TOTAL_LINEAR: Total of length + width + height

commonCabinCode.description:
Enumeration of cabin class codes
 - CABIN_UNSPECIFIED: Default unspecified
 - Y: Economy (Y) class
 - W: Premium Economy (W) class
 - C: Business (C) class
 - F: First (F) class

ownerCode.description:
Optional. Owner offering the discount. This can be
 - IATA-defined 2-character code identifying an airline or GDS
 - an identifier like 'LHG' for Lufthansa Group
 - IATA number of travel agency
 - If not provided it is assumed that the owner is the offer/order responsible airline.

percent.description:
Optional. Stores the percentage which was used to determine the Fee to be charged in conjunction or not with
`min_amount` and `max_amount`

maxAmount.description: Optional. Stores an Maximum fee amount which will be charged when a variable fee amount is effective.

minAmount.description: Optional. Stores an Minimum fee amount which will be charged when a variable fee amount is effective.

approxInd.description: Optional. When true, this fee is approximate.

descText.description: Optional. Fee description.  Example: Change penalty

commonChangeOrCancelFee.description: Amount added on to a charge for changes to an already reserved product, purpose, or service.

commonChannel.description:
Enumeration of channels through with air products are sourced
 - NDC: Default NDC channel
 - DIRECT_CONNECT: Proprietary direct connect channel
 - GDS_1A: Amadeus GDS channel
 - GDS_1G: Galileo GDS channel
 - GDS_1S: Sabre GDS channel

amount.description: Required. Commission amount and currency code. Example: 20 USD

commissionCode.description:
Required.The node will have a code to identify between  commission configured in Verteil by airline admin (VDC-AirAd), Open connect admin or commission provided by airline through their APIs.
Example: 1000, BFST

percentage.description:
Optional.The node will have information on the commission percentage. The element will not be present if the comission is a fixed amount and not a percentage.
Example: 20

commonCommission.description:
Optional. An amount of money, typically a set percentage of the value involved, paid to an agent in a commercial transaction.
Total commission applicable for the order. Sum of all commissions applied at orderitem level. Currently, commission is only applied on flight item.

contactPurpose.description: Optional. Identifies the purpose of this contact. E.g. contact at origin or emergency contact

individual.description: Optional. Identifies a single human individual as distinct from a group, class, or family.

postalAddresses.description: Optional. Physical address used for postal service.

emailAddresses.description: Optional. The email address which should be used for contact purposes.

paxSegmentRefId.description: Optional. Reference to a Pax Segment ID.

contactRefusedInd.description: Optional. When TRUE, Contact Information was refused to be provided.

commonContactInfo.description:
The electronic or geographic address which a party has provided as the contact channel. For example, contact email,
contact postal address, contact phone number.

commonContactPurpose.description: Enumeration of contact purposes. Based on PADIS code list 3299

commonContactType.description: Enumeration of contact types. Based on PADIS code list: Contact Type

amount.description: Required. Amount and currency specified in the converted currency. Example: `INR 124100`

sourceAmount.description: Required. Source amount and currency used for conversion. E.g. `USD 1500`

multiplierValue.description: The conversion rate used to convert from `source_amount` to `amount`. E.g. `80.8716018`

format.description: Optional. The converted currency format. E.g. `1`

operatingLegId.description: Required. Uniquely identifies a leg within the context of one message.

dep.description: Required. IATA 3-letter code defining the departure city or airport code.

arrival.description: Required. IATA 3-letter code defining the arrival city or airport code.

aircraftType.description: Optional. Code assigned to an aircraft type in IATA SSIM.

commonDatedLeg.description: The nonstop operation of an aircraft between the departure station and the arrival station.

legRefIds.description: References to dated operating flight legs of a passenger segment

commonDatedOperatingLegsRef.description: Holds references to dated operating flight legs of a passenger segment

commonDatedOperatingLegsRefs.description: Holds references to dated operating flight legs possibly belonging to different passenger segments

dimensionCategory.description: Required. Dimension category - Length, Width, Height or Total Linear (Length + Width + Height)

unit.description: Required. Dimension unit of measurement - e.g. CM

commonDimension.description: Dimension category, min/max values and unit

appParty.description:
Optional. Baggage weight restriction application. E.g. `PER_PAX` or `PARTY`. Party applies to all passengers.
Default `PER_PAX` application applies if not explicitly specified

combination.description:
Optional. Specifies how this allowance combines with others allowances in the container list
 - `AND` indicates that multiple allowances are applicable
 - `OR` indicates that any one allowance is applicable
Default `AND` applies if not explicitly specified.

appBagTypes.description: Optional. Applicable baggage types - e.g. Laptop bag, briefcase etc.

commonDimensionAllowance.description: Baggage dimension allowance with application information.

commonDimensionUnit.description:
Enumeration of units of measurement for dimension
 - DIMENSION_UNIT_UNSPECIFIED: Default unspecified
 - CM: Centimeter
 - IN: Inch

ownerCode.description:
Optional. Owner providing this discount. This can be
 - IATA-defined 2-character code identifying an airline or GDS
 - an identifier like 'LHG' for Lufthansa Group
 - IATA number of travel agency
 - If not provided it is assumed that the owner is the offer/order responsible airline.

preDiscountedAmount.description: Optional. The original price on which the discount was applied to.

percent.description: Optional. The percentage that was used to determine the Discount.

commonDiscount.description: Deduction from the price amount, made in advance of its payment.

contactType.description: Optional. Type of contact. E.g. Home or Business or Agency Customer Support. Defaults to `TYPE_OTHER`

emailAddressText.description: The email address which should be used for contact purposes.

commonEmailAddress.description: The email address which should be used for contact purposes.

code.description: The code corresponding to the processing error as defined by PADIS 9321.

descTexts.description: Free text description of the provided error.

tagText.description: Identifies the tag/XPath which relates to the provided Error.

commonError.description: Contains information related to errors detected during processing of the preceding request.

pricingCodeText.description: Optional. Primary identifier reflecting the method of pricing for a transaction.

addlInfoText.description: Optional. The fare calculation text required in the fare calculation area of an electronic ticket.

reportingCodeText.description: Optional. Secondary identifier reflecting the method of pricing for a transaction used in the reporting process.

commonFareCalculationInfo.description: Information related to the calculation of the Fare amount by applying various rules to determine a final fare for an airline ticket.

cabinCode.description:
Required. Type of cabin/compartment. E.g. Y (Economy),C (Business) etc.
If no value is received, then default `CABIN_UNSPECIFIED` applies

cabinName.description: Optional. Name given to a cabin compartment (e.g. Business, First, Economy).

priceClassRefId.description: Optional. Identifies price class (fare family) within the cabin

paxSegmentRefId.description: Required. Reference to passenger segments that are covered by this fare component

fbc.description: Optional. Fare basis code. Example: Y26

fareType.description: Optional. Fare type codes. E.g. PUBL (Published), MR (Marine), PVT (Private) etc.

rbd.description:
Optional. Reservation Booking Designator. A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares,
and to identify cabin entitlement.

seatsLeft.description:
Optional. The number of seats remaining in this RBD. This will be available only of the supplier provides remaining
seats counts.

ticketDesigCode.description:
Optional. The Fare Basis Code Designator shall be placed within this element and removed from the Fare Basis Code element.
For example, if the Airline has a fare basis code with a designator like `JFBC/WO`, The `fbc` field will
contain `JFBC` and this field will contain `WO`.

fareRule.description: Optional. Reference to a Penalty ID

augRefIds.description:
Optional. References to augmentations. API consumers must relay all `Augmentation`s referred in the offer they select in
subsequent pricing call.

commonFareComponent.description:
A portion of an itinerary between two consecutive fare construction points. If the journey has only one fare component,
the points of origin and destination are the only fare construction points

passengerRefs.description: Required. Passengers associated with the specific Fare Detail instance. Allows the Price breakdown of the fare for the offeritem per passenger.

farePriceTypeCode.description:
Optional. Price application mode - e.g. PER_PAX
Default `PER_PAX` fare_price_type_code applies if not explicitly specified

price.description: Required. Total price of all FareComponent prices. Price reflects a per-passenger price referenced within this FareDetail.

fareWaivers.description: Optional. Validating carrier-assigned fare rule modification or override information.

fareComponents.description:
Required. A portion of an itinerary between two consecutive fare construction points. If the journey has only one fare component,
the points of origin and destination are the only fare construction points

tourCode.description: Optional. A tag on the fare used for accounting and backend processing E.g. Deal code

accountCode.description: Optional. Corporate account ID E.g. CLID

fareCalculationInfo.description:
Optional.
Information related to the calculation of the Fare amount by applying various rules to determine a final fare for an airline ticket.

penaltyRefIds.description:
Optional.
Reference to Penalty IDs. In Reshop scenario the Fee charged by the carrier to make a change for one passenger will be provided in the Penalty referred here.

augRefIds.description:
Optional. References to augmentations. API consumers must relay all `Augmentation`s referred in the offer they select in
subsequent pricing call.

commonFareDetail.description: Fare Code Indicator to represent pricing method (IATA PADIS Code List for data element 5387 - Price Type Qualifier)

commonFareTypeCode.description:
Fare type codes
 - FARE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default unspecified
 - PUBL: Published Fare
 - MR: Marine Fare
 - PVT: Agency Private Fare
 - IT: Inclusive Tours Fare
 - ITD: Inclusive Tours Fare Deferred (BA specific)
 - ITSD: Inclusive Tours Fare Semi Deferred (BA specific)
 - CF: Corporate Fare
 - CB: Contract bulk
 - HR: Humanitarian
 - PA: Private adult
 - LBR: Labour fare
 - STU: Student fare
 - VFR: Visit Friends & Relatives
 - CRU: Cruise fare

commonFeatureCategory.description: Enumeration of product or service feature categories  - FEATURE_UNSPECIFIED: Default unknown category

category.description: Optional. Category of the feature - e.g. _LOUNGE_

descTexts.description: Optional. An account or representation of the feature

mediaRefId.description: Optional. References to media depicting the feature

paxSegmentRefIds.description: Optional. References to pax segments for which these features are applicable

commonFeatureDesc.description: Describes a product or service feature

ownerCode.description:
Optional. Owner applying this fee. This can be
 - IATA-defined 2-character code identifying an airline or GDS
 - an identifier like 'LHG' for Lufthansa Group
 - IATA number of travel agency
 - If not provided it is assumed that the owner is the offer/order responsible airline.

percent.description:
Optional. Stores the percentage which was used to determine the Fee to be charged in conjunction or not with
`min_amount` and `max_amount`

maxAmount.description: Optional. Stores an Maximum fee amount which will be charged when a variable fee amount is effective.

minAmount.description: Optional. Stores an Minimum fee amount which will be charged when a variable fee amount is effective.

approxInd.description: Optional. When true, this fee is approximate.

refundInd.description: Optional. When true, fee amount is refundable.

descText.description: Optional. Fee/surcharge Description.  Example: U.S Customs User Fee

includedInBaseFare.description: Optional. Indicates if fee/surcharge is included in base fare.

commonFee.description: Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

birthdate.description:
Optional. The date on which an individual was born.
Will be in ISO-8601 format - `yyyy-MM-dd'. E.g. 2012-02-01

genderCode.description: Optional. Gender of the individual (M, F, or X for unspecified).

titleName.description: Optional. A word such as Mr., Mrs., Miss or Dr that is used before an individual's name to indicate the gender, profession or marital status.

givenNames.description: Optional. A personal name given to the individual at birth and used before a family name. Also called first name. E.g. JOHN.

middleNames.description: Optional. Individual's middle name or initial.  E.g. G, GEORGE. Upto

surname.description: Required. Individual's hereditary name(s) common to all members of a family. Also known as family name or last name. E.g. SMITH. Excludes any potential suffix.

commonIndividual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

commonJourneyStageCode.description:
Enumeration of stages of a passenger journey
 - AFTER_DEP_NO_SHOW: After departure No Show
 - PRIOR_TO_DEP: Prior to departure (PDE)
 - AFTER_DEP: After departure (ADE)
 - SUBSEQUENT_NO_SHOW: Subsequent No Show

allianceCode.description: Optional. Two or more airlines participating in a commercial relationship or joint venture, where a joint and commonly identifiable product is marketed under a single commercial name or brand.

carrierCode.description: Optional. IATA-defined 2-character code identifying the airline which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

programCode.description: Optional. Loyalty Program ID: Example: OnBusiness

commonLoyaltyProgram.description:
A rewards program offered by a company to customers who frequently make purchases, which may give a customer advanced access to new products, special sales coupons or free merchandise.
At least one of alliance_code or carrier_code or program_code must be set.

loyaltyProgram.description: Required. A rewards program offered by a company to customers who frequently make purchases, which may give a customer advanced access to new products, special sales coupons or free merchandise.

accountNumber.description: Required. Loyalty Program account number. Example: ABC123456

commonLoyaltyProgramAccount.description: An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

carrierCode.description: Required. IATA-defined 2-character code identifying the airline which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

flightNumber.description: Required. The numerical designation of a flight as it is marketed by a carrier.

operationalSuffix.description: Optional. Used to distinguish two flights having the same flight number and departing from their respective Origin Stations on the same date.

rbdCode.description: Optional. Code used to identify a particular RBD (e.g. P, J, W, M, etc.).

commonMarketingInfo.description: The commercial designation under which a Dated Operating Segment can be booked, either under the operating carrier's designator or that of another carrier (codeshare).

amount.description: Required. Value and sold-in currency added as part of the offer reported as calculation detail.

typeCode.description: Optional. Defines the reason for the markup added by an airline as part of the offer reported as calculation detail. (Examples: currency markup, service markup, etc).

commonMarkup.description: Defines the reason for the markup added by an airline as part of the offer reported as calculation detail. The amount added to the cost price of goods to cover overhead and profit.

descText.description: Optional. Description of the referenced media.

mediaLinks.description: Required. Links to media of different types and sizes

commonMedia.description: Electronic documents, images, and other files which accompany and support a product's description.

url.description:
Required. The Uniform Resource Locator that identifies the media and where the it is located.
API consumers are expected to access the media content by following this URL

type.description:
Optional. Media type
If not provided, default type is `IMAGE`

commonMediaSize.description:
Enumeration of media size
 - SMALL: Image- less than or equal to 150x150px
 - MEDIUM: Image-less than or equal to 350x350px
 - LARGE: Image-less than or equal to 600x600px
 - X_LARGE: Images larger than 600x600px

commonMediaType.description:
Enumeration of media types
 - IMAGE: Image
 - DOC: Document
 - VIDEO: Video

offerRefId.description: Required. Reference to an Offer for which this payment method applies.

ownerCode.description:
Required. Identifier for the owner of this Offer and responsible for the delivery of the items.
For air content, this is the IATA-defined 2-character code of the carrier owning the offer.

channel.description:
Optional. The channel though which the offer was sourced.
When not provided, default 'NDC' channel applies.

offerItemRefId.description:
Optional. Reference to OfferItems within the Offer for which this payment method applies.
If empty, the payment method is applicable to all OfferItems in the Offer.

commonOfferAssociation.description: Reference to Offer and optionally OfferItems for which this payment method applies.

paxJourneyRefs.description:
Required. Passenger journeys to which the services is associated
One of `pax_journey_refs` or `pax_segment_refs` or `leg_refs`

paxSegmentRefs.description:
Required. Passenger segments to which the service is associated
One of `pax_journey_refs` or `pax_segment_refs` or `leg_refs`

legsRefs.description:
Required. Dated operating flight legs to which the service is associated
One of `pax_journey_refs` or `pax_segment_refs` or `legs_refs`

serviceDefRefId.description: References a Service Definition within this message.

commonOfferServiceDefinitionRef.description: Association of `ServiceDefinition` with a journey/OD, segment or leg in an offer or an order

carrierCode.description: Required. IATA-defined 2-character code identifying the airline which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc.

flightNumber.description: Optional. The numerical designation of a flight as it is marketed by a carrier.

operationalSuffix.description: Optional. The numerical designation of a flight as it is marketed by a carrier.

rbdCode.description: Optional. Code used to identify a particular RBD (e.g. P, J, W, M, etc.).

orderRefId.description: Reference to an Order for which this payment method applies.

ownerCode.description:
Identifier for the owner of this Order responsible for the delivery of the items .
For air content, this is the IATA-defined 2-character code of the carrier owning the order.

channel.description:
Optional. The channel though which this order is created and managed.
When not provided, default 'NDC' channel applies.

orderItemRefId.description:
Optional. Reference to Order Item IDs within the Order for which this payment method applies.
If empty, the payment method is applicable to all OrderItems in the Order.

commonOrderAssociation.description: Reference to Order and optionally OrderItems for which this payment method applies.

commonParty.description: A party is an individual, a group, or a body having a role in the transaction. E.g. a corporation identified by a `corporate_id` is a party

commonPassengerTypeCode.description:
Type of passengers.

 - ADT: Default Adult
 - YADT: Young Adult
 - CHD: Child
 - INF: Infant

ptc.description: Optional. Type code applying to the Passenger which typically drives pricing (e.g. ADT, CHD, etc).

paxRefId.description: Optional. Reference to a Passenger ID within this message, associating an infant on lap to this adult Passenger.

individual.description: Optional. A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

loyaltyProgramAccounts.description: Optional. An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

citizenshipCountryCode.description: Optional. ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

commonPax.description:
Any person except members of the crew to be carried with the consent of the carrier, on board an aircraft.
Holds the attributes specific to a one booking, from shopping to fulfillment.

origin.description: Required. IATA 3-letter code defining the origin city or airport code.

dest.description: Required. IATA 3-letter code defining the destination city or airport code.

duration.description: Optional. Total journey time in ISO 8601 format, including the combined air time and connection times.

paxSegmentRefIds.description: Required. References to passenger segments involved in this journey.

commonPaxJourney.description: A collection of segments which satisfies transportation of passenger for a given origin and destination.

secureFlightIndicator.description: Optional. When TRUE, this segment is subject to US TSA 'Secure Flight' passenger prescreening program.

dep.description: Required. Departure details of the segment.

arrival.description: Required. Arrival details of the segment.

aircraftType.description: Optional. Code assigned to an aircraft type in IATA SSIM.

duration.description: Optional. Total segment time in ISO 8601 format, including the combined air time and connection times of any legs.

legs.description:
Optional. The operating legs that form this segment.
This will be set only for multi leg flights.

marketingInfo.description: Required. The commercial designation under which a Dated Operating Segment can be booked, either under the operating carrier's designator or that of another carrier (codeshare).

operatingInfo.description:
Optional. Operating segment information.
This will be set only if operating flight is different from marketing flight

commonPaxSegment.description: Transportation of a passenger on a Dated Operating Segment.

paxRefId.description:
Reference ID of a pax in the same message.
To be used if payment is done using a personal card of a passenger
Only one of `pax_ref_id` or `individual_name` or `organisation_name` should be provided

individualName.description:
To be used if the payment is done using a personal card belonging to someone who is not a passenger
Only one of `pax_ref_id` or `individual_name` or `organisation_name` should be provided

organisationName.description:
To be used if the payment is done using a corporate card
Only one of `pax_ref_id` or `individual_name` or `organisation_name` should be provided

payerEmailAddress.description: Optional. Email address of the payer

payerPhoneNumber.description: Optional. Contact phone number of the payer

commonPayer.description:
Information on the party committing to pay.
Applicable to card payments.

commonPayerIndividual.description: To be used if the payment is done using a personal card

commonPayerOrganisation.description: To be used if the payment is done using a corporate card

offerAssociations.description:
Optional. Reference to an Offer and optionally OfferItems for which this payment method applies.
If empty, the payment method is applicable to all Offers in the Super Order

orderAssociations.description:
Optional. Reference to an Order and optionally OrderItems for which this payment method applies.
If empty, the payment method is applicable to the entire Order

paymentMethodCriteria.description: Optional. Contains information relating to payer preference.

commonPaymentAssociatedFunctionCriteria.description: Container of all payment relevant functions in the context of an order reprice/requote  request

cardBrandCode.description: Required. A two-letter code assigned according to IATA Resolution 728. Example: VI for Visa

tokenizedCardId.description:
Identifies a tokenized card number in PCI Proxy.
Used when calls are routed through PCI Proxy.

cardNumber.description:
The actual card number as indicated on the payment card.
Passing actual card data in this field is strongly discouraged.
To be used in scenarios where PCI Proxy cannot be used.

cardSecurityCode.description:
Optional. 3-digit number printed on the signature panel on the back of the card
and following the last four digits of the Primary Account Number (PAN).
For American Express, 4 digits located on the front of the card,
above the card number on the right hand side.
Visa - CVV2, MasterCard - CVC2, American Express - CID,
Discover - CMID, Union Pay - CVN2, JCB - CAV2.

cardHolderName.description: Optional. Name of credit card holder. Example: JOHN SMITH

effectiveDate.description: Optional. Payment Card Effective Date in mmyy format. Example: 0116

expirationDate.description: Optional. The last month of validity in mmyy format. Example: 0123

verificationInd.description:
Optional. When 'true', this payment requires additional authentication.
Should not set (i.e. should be `false`) for MOTO transactions
Please refer https://guides.developer.iata.org/docs/secure-customer-authentication scenario C.
Specifically
> Booking Agents should not request exemptions at the authentication stage of transactions for which they
> are not collecting the funds unless they have a specific agreement with the travel supplier (the merchant)
> and its acquirer to do so. This is essential as the use of exemptions is the prerogative of the merchants acquirer,
> not that of an Agent. The secure corporate payment exemption can generally be used when the booking is initiated
> from a dedicated corporate processes which is not available to consumers and which is considered secure.
> Typically only Travel Management Companies (TMCs) will be permitted to use this exemption.

cardProductTypeCode.description:
Optional. Represents card product type.
Default value : Unknown card type
P-personal or C-Commercial

securePaymentVersion2.description:
Optional. Contains all information for the result of 3D-Secure authentication process.
Applicable to 3DS v2.0 and higher.

commonPaymentCardTrxPaymentCard.description:
Payment card transaction details.
Please refer https://guides.developer.iata.org/docs/secure-customer-authentication
Note that calls must be routed through a PCI Proxy when payment card details are involved.
Please ask your Verteil contact for details of PCI Proxy endpoint

offerAssociation.description:
Optional. Reference to an Offer and optionally OfferItems for which this payment method applies.
If empty, the payment method is applicable to all Offers in the Super Order

paymentProcessingDetails.description: Required. Form of payment details including the amount.

commonPaymentFunctionChange.description: Container of all payment relevant functions in the context of an order change transaction

offerAssociations.description:
Optional. Reference to an Offer and optionally OfferItems for which this payment method applies.
If empty, the payment method is applicable to all Offers in the Super Order

orderAssociations.description:
Optional. Reference to an Order and optionally OrderItems for which this payment method applies.
If empty, the payment method is applicable to the entire Order

paymentSupportedMethod.description: Contains information relating to payment method acceptance.

commonPaymentFunctionOffer.description: Container of all payment relevant functions in the context of an order reshop response

commonPaymentMethod.description:
Form of payment details.
Choice of:
- payment_card
\
Other options (e.g. LoyaltyRedemption) will be added in future

paymentTypeCode.description: Required. Identifies the form of payment.

paymentBrandCode.description: Optional. A Payment Brand code assigned according to ATS Codeset PAYB. Example VI for Visa

cardProductTypeCode.description:
Optional. Represents card product type.
P-personal or C-Commercial

issuerIdentificationNumber.description: Optional. Leading eight digits of the card number defining issuer identification number (IIN) or bank identification number (BIN)

commonPaymentMethodCriteria.description: Contains information relating to payer preference.

typeCode.description: Required. Identifies the form of payment.

amount.description: Required. The amount applied to the associated payment method. Example: 300 USD

payer.description:
Optional. Party committing to pay.
Required for card payments.

paymentMethod.description: Optional. Transactional information specific to the payment method other than the amount. E.g. Credit Card details.

paymentSurchargeAmount.description:
Optional.
Amount added to the final Offer/Order price like a payment processing charge, depending on which payment method is used by the payer.

paymentRefId.description:
Optional.
The id reference of the already authorized form of payment.
If creating the order after payment authorization it is a way of linking an order to an existing payment reference.
for eg:- If the payment is done via IFG, this holds the value of the ifg track id.

commonPaymentProcessingDetails.description: Form of payment details including the amount.

paymentSurcharge.description: Optional. Information about surcharges for payment methods.

paymentTypeCode.description: Required. Identifies the form of payment.

commonPaymentSupportedMethod.description: Contains information relating to payment method acceptance.

preciseAmount.description: Required. Maximum fee or charges for a payment method

commonPaymentSurcharge.description: Information about surcharges for payment methods. E.g. Credit card payment fee charged by an airline.

commonPaymentTypeCode.description:
Enumeration of form of payment codes.

 - CA: Cash
 - CC: Credit Card
 - AC: Agency Credit
 - APP_PSP: External Payment Service Provider
 - PAY_BY_LINK: Inbound form of payment when payment is done through a link to customer.
 - AIRLINE_INVOICE: Airline Invoice
 - AG: Airline Agency Pay
 - WL: Verteil Wallet
 - MS: Miscellaneous
 - EP: Easy Pay

type.description: Required. Penalty type - Change, Cancel etc.

descTexts.description: Optional. Description of the applicable penalty.

feeInd.description: Optional. When TRUE, fee(s) may apply based on PenaltyType

netInd.description:
Optional. For each penalty involved in a voluntary servicing action, the airline should inform the seller if the penalty is
netted (i.e. taken from any amount that the Airline will owe to the customer consequently to the servicing) or
to be paid (i.e. charged to the customer upfront any servicing action, and even if customer benefits from a subsequent refund/ residual value).

penaltyPrice.description: Either Penalty price information or Restrictions with fee details

penaltyRestrictions.description: Either Penalty price information or Restrictions with fee details. A set of qualifying conditions/rules/restriction that are related to a Cancellation/Change/modification action.

commonPenalty.description: Information relating to Rules conditions of a offer/order contract (E.g. Change rule, Cancel rule etc.) or penalty imposed as per contract (E.g. Change Fee, Cancellation Fee etc.).

commonPenaltyType.description:
Enumeration of penalty types
 - OTHERS: Any other type of penalties apart from the specified ones
 - CHANGE: Change penalty
 - CANCEL: Cancellation penalty
 - NO_SHOW: No show penalty
 - UPGRADE: Upgrade penalty

contactType.description: Optional. Type of contact. E.g. Home or Business or Agency Customer Support. Defaults to `TYPE_OTHER`

countryDialingCode.description: Required. Numeric telephone dialing prefixes for the member countries of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU).

appParty.description:
Optional. Baggage weight restriction application. E.g. `PER_PAX` or `PARTY`. Party applies to all passengers.
Default `PER_PAX` application applies if not explicitly specified

combination.description:
Optional. Specifies how this allowance combines with others allowances in the container list
 - `AND` indicates that multiple allowances are applicable
 - `OR` indicates that any one allowance is applicable
Default `AND` applies if not explicitly specified.

appBagTypes.description: Optional. Applicable baggage types - e.g. Laptop bag, briefcase etc.

pieceWeightAllowances.description: Optional. Baggage weight restrictions applicable to this piece allowance.

pieceDimensionAllowances.description: Optional. Baggage dimension restrictions applicable to this piece allowance.

commonPieceAllowance.description: Defines the maximum number of each allowable baggage type along with applicable weight and dimension restrictions.

contactType.description: Optional. Type of contact. E.g. Home or Business or Agency Customer Support. Defaults to `TYPE_OTHER`

streetTexts.description: Optional. Street name and number. Examples: Main Street, 100 Main Street

cityName.description: Required. The name, expressed as text, of the city, town or village.

countryName.description: Required. The name, expressed as text, of the country.

countryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

countrySubDivisionName.description: Optional. The name, expressed as text, of the sub-division of a country. E.g. California.

commonPostalAddress.description: Natural or physical address used for postal service. May be a building address, airport address, etc.

totalAmount.description: Required. Total monetary price amount, including all tax, surcharge, and fee amounts.

baseAmount.description: Optional. Base Amount excluding taxes, fees, and surcharges.  Example: 200000

taxSummaries.description:
Optional. A compulsory contribution to state revenue, levied by the government on workers' income and business profits or added to the cost of some goods, services, and transactions.
If TaxSummary is not provided in the response, tax would be 0 for the fare under scope.

fees.description: Optional. Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

discounts.description: Optional. Deductions from the price amount, made in advance of its payment.

markups.description: Optional. The amount added to the cost price of goods to cover overhead and profit.

dueByAirlineAmount.description: Optional. The Amount held by the Airline

commonPrice.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

cabinCode.description: Optional. Cabin offering this price class

displayOrder.description:
Optional. An ordinal number of this price class that may be used to order price classes in cabin.
Price classes offering more features and consequently having higher fares typically get higher ordinal value

features.description: Optional. Features of this price class - e.g. _Lounge Access_.

commonPriceClass.description: A price point within a particular Cabin Type (sometimes referred to as 'Fare Families').

remarkType.description:
Optional. The type of remark - public vs internal
If not specified, defaults to PUBLIC

agentId.description:
Optional.
The agent who has updated/added the remark.

commonRemark.description: Supplementary information which will not be processed by the system.

effectiveTime.description: Optional. The effective date used in conjunction with the Expiration date to qualify the applicability of this condition

expirationTime.description: Optional. The Expiration date used in conjunction with the Effective date to qualify the applicability of this condition

fee.description: Required. Amount added on to a charge for changes to an already reserved product, purpose, or service.

modificationAllowedInd.description:
Optional. Indicates whether modification is allowed.
If this is set to FALSE then the condition further identified by the other attributes indicates that no Change is allowed.

changeTypeCode.description: Required. The type of change that applies to the condition. E.g. NAME, FLIGHT

descText.description:
Optional. Describes what this restriction is. E.g.
 * Change allowed within dates(1) specified with associated fee.
 * Change allowed within dates(2) specified with associated fee.
 * No change allowed
 * No change allowed

restrictions.description: Required. A set of rules with fees applicable for the restriction

commonRestrictions.description:
A set of qualifying conditions/rules/restriction that are related to a constrained priced grouping of
services for a Cancellation/Change/modification action.

rowNumber.description: Ordinal number identifying a seat row on a transport vehicle

columnId.description: Alphabetic character identifying a seat within a row.

seatProfileRefId.description: Optional. Reference to a Seat Profile ID within this message.

commonSeat.description: A sitting place for a passenger or crew in a cabin compartment on a transport vehicle.

segmentLegs.description: References to dated operating flight legs possibly belonging to different passenger segments

seat.description: A sitting place for a passenger or crew in a cabin compartment on a transport vehicle.

serviceDefRefId.description: Optional. References a Service Definition within this message.

commonSeatAssignment.description:
The Seat Location selected by the Passenger (via SeatAvailability)
or assigned to the Passenger by the Airline for a given segment.
When used, only a single Passenger must be referenced within the Service.

seatProfileId.description: Required. Unique identifier associated to this Seat Profile.

seatCharCodes.description: Optional. Characteristic of an aircraft seat e.g. A (Aisle seat), E (Exit and emergency exit) etc.

commonSeatProfile.description: Airline defined group of seats sharing common characteristics.

authenticationTokenValue.description: Optional. Authentication value of a Token

cardNumberCollectionCode.description:
Optional. Indicates the collection method of the card number.
This will be newly entered or using previously saved information.

payerAuthenticationExemptionCode.description:
Optional. Used to identify an exemption to performing payer authentication.
Default value : ND (None defined)

payerAuthenticationFailureToCompleteCode.description: Optional. Used to identify possible pre defined reasons for failure to complete payer authentication.

paymentTrxChannelCode.description:
Optional. Indicates the payment transaction channel
Default value : NS (Not specified)

commonSecurePaymentVersion2.description:
Contains all information for the result of 3D-Secure authentication process.
Applicable to 3DS v2.0 and higher.

maxServiceQty.description:
Optional. The maximum number of service definitions that may be selected from those in the bundle.
The default is no limit.

serviceDefRefIds.description: Required. References to services included in the bundle

commonServiceBundle.description: A set of services offered for sale as a single service.

ownerCode.description: Optional. IATA-defined 2-character code of the carrier owning the service

rfic.description: Optional. Service category. Roughly corresponds to IATA Reason For Issuance Code (RFIC).

rficSubCode.description: Optional. Service sub categories. Roughly corresponds to Reason For Issuance Sub Code. Examples: 0CC (First Checked Bag) 0B1 (In-flight Entertainment) 0BX (Lounge)

ssrCode.description: Optional. Airline specific service code which can be associated with the Reason for Issuance Sub Code. Sample implementer encoding: XLEG for Extra Leg Room Seat XBAG for Extra Bag

serviceDefAssociation.description:
Optional. Service Definition Association Choice to determine if the information of this ServiceDefinition needs to be extended
with specific Bag or Seat characteristics or whether the ServiceDefinition is used as a bundle of further
ServiceDefinitions.

desc.description: Optional. A representation of major characteristics or features of the service.

depositTltTime.description: Optional. The date by which a deposit must be paid for the service Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

nameTltTime.description: Optional. The time by which an Order must be completed with individual passenger names

commonServiceDefinition.description: Description and characteristics of a non-flight product or service that can be separately sold and delivered. E.g. bag, seat, meal on a flight.

baggageAllowanceRefId.description:
Required. Reference to a Baggage Allowance
Either `baggage_allowance_ref_id` or `service_bundle` is set

serviceBundle.description:
Required. A set of services offered for sale as a single service.
Either `baggage_allowance_ref_id` or `service_bundle` is set

commonServiceDefinitionAssociation.description:
Service Definition Association Choice to determine if the information of this ServiceDefinition needs to be extended
with specific Bag or Seat characteristics or whether the ServiceDefinition is used as a bundle of further
ServiceDefinitions.

stationCode.description: Required. IATA 3-letter code specifying the city or airport code

terminalName.description: Optional. The name of the terminal.

schedDateTime.description:
Required. The Scheduled Date and Time of arrival of the aircraft at the terminal or the departure from gate.
Will be in ISO-8601 format - `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm`. E.g. `2021-12-03T10:15`

aircraftType.description: Optional. Code assigned to an aircraft type in IATA SSIM.

commonStation.description: Defines a transport point or station.

totalAmount.description: Required. Total of all surcharge amounts.

commonSurcharge.description: Amount added on to a usual charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

taxCode.description: Optional. Tax Code. Example: AY, GB

descText.description: Optional. Tax short description. Example: $4 per flight segment, per passenger (U.S. domestic segment tax)

refundInd.description: Optional. When true, this tax amount is refundable.

qualifierCode.description: Optional. Used to specify if current, paid, additional taxes Refer to IATA PADIS Code list data element 5305

collectionInd.description: Optional. When true, this tax amount must be collected

commonTax.description:
A compulsory contribution to state revenue, levied by the government on workers' income and business profits or added
to the cost of some goods, services, and transactions.

totalTaxAmount.description: Required. Total of all applicable tax amounts included in the price.  If tax breakdowns are provided, this amount should match the sum of the tax breakdown amounts.

allRefundableInd.description: Optional. When true, all tax breakdown amounts are refundable.

approximateInd.description: Optional. When true, this tax is approximate.

collectionInd.description: Optional. When true, all specified tax breakdowns must be collected.

breakdown.description: Optional. Individual tax breakdown. This will not be provided during shopping but will be available from subsequent pricing response onwards.

commonTaxSummary.description: Tax summary information, including total tax amount and optional tax breakdown

code.description:
A code corresponding to the processing warning that can be handled by API consumer.
Possible warnings codes that can be returned will be documented against each service

message.description: Free text description of the provided warning.

details.description: Optional. Any type object providing further details about the warning.

commonWarning.description:
Contains information related to potential business errors/warnings detected during
processing of the preceding request.

appParty.description:
Optional. Baggage weight restriction application. E.g. `PER_PAX` or `PARTY`. Party applies to all passengers.
Default `PER_PAX` application applies if not explicitly specified

combination.description:
Optional. Specifies how this allowance combines with others weight allowances in the container list.
 - `AND` indicates that multiple allowances are applicable
 - `OR` indicates that any one allowance is applicable
Default `AND` applies if not explicitly specified.

appBagTypes.description: Optional. Applicable baggage types - e.g. Laptop bag, briefcase etc.

unit.description: Required. Weight unit of measurement - e.g. KG

commonWeightAllowance.description: Baggage weight allowance with application information.

commonWeightUnit.description:
Enumeration of units of measurement for weight
 - WEIGHT_UNIT_UNSPECIFIED: Default unspecified
 - KG: Kilogram
 - LB: Pound

flightRequest.description: Required. Choice of Origin Destination or Journey flight information for this shopping request.

shoppingCriteria.description:
Optional. Further qualifies the flight request by influencing which results are returned in the shopping response,
including preferred or required criteria.

responseControls.description: Optional. Guidance on how the response should be returned - sorting, maximum number of results etc.

offerItemId.description: Required. Unique identifier for this OfferItem instance. Must be unique within XML message.

reshopPriceAndFareDetails.description:
Required. For each offer item, `reshop_price_and_fare_details` allows carrier to inform the seller about the price and fare details
associated with this offer item.
\
Carriers can provide this information in two ways
1- New Offer: Price of the new offer re-shopped by the user.
2- Differential Offer: Difference between the existing order and new offer re-shopped by the user.

offeredServices.description:
Required. Offered Service is the instance of a specific flight or Service Definition as it has been offered (and eventually ordered and consumed)
in the context of a specific Offer and/or Order.

offerAddedOfferItem.description: A priced grouping of one or more services within an Added Offer.

orderItemRefId.description: Required. Reference to the Order Item requested for deletion.

retainServiceRefIds.description:
Optional. Reference to the Service within the specified Order Item which the Passenger would like the Airline to retain and
return within the proposed Offer Item(s) in the OrderReshopRS.

offerAffectedOrderItemRequest.description:
Contains affected existing order items and related services that will be impacted by any new offers in the message.
The primary use case is when an existing order item is to be deleted or partial deletion either with a replacement
in a new offer or an offer to be used for the deletion.

paxJourneyRefIds.description: Required. References to pax journeys where the allowance apply

paxRefIds.description: Required. References to passengers for whom the allowance apply

baggageAllowanceRefId.description: Required. Reference to applicable baggage allowance

offerBaggageAllowanceSpec.description: Specification of baggage allowances eligible for a set of passengers on a set of pax journeys.

offerId.description: Required. Uniquely Identifies an Offer within the context of one message.

ownerCode.description: Required. Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

addOfferItems.description:
Required. Offers presented in response to a reshop query with Add or Replace function.
If original query also specified items for deletion, the suggested OfferItems here could be meant to replace the
OrderItems specified in the request's Delete function.
\
Price and FareDetails can be presented either in the Differential or "New" structure based on airline behaviour.

offerExpirationDateTime.description:
Required. The time in ISO8601 format by which the offer must be converted into an order. Example:  2015-01-13T13:59:38Z
Upon expiry, the expectation is that the offer is no longer retrievable and the shopping process must begin again.
Note the presence of an Offer Time Limit does not indicate either a guarantee of price or inventory against a given
Offer item within the Offer. Should the offer time limit expire, any other time limit also expires unless an Order
has been created or changed.
When an offer does not have an expiry the time limit will value will be 9999-12-31T23:59:59Z

paymentTimeLimitDateTime.description: Optional. The time in ISO8601 format by which a commitment to pay must be made for the confirmed items in the offer. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

priceGuaranteeTimeLimitDateTime.description: Optional. The time in ISO8601 format after which the offer price is no longer guaranteed. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

commissions.description: Optional. Commissions applicable on the offer.

totalPrice.description: Required. The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

journeyOverviews.description: Required. Price class information per Journey. The order of the array will be the order of the flights in the itinerary

baggageAllowanceSpecs.description: Optional. Eligible baggage allowances for passengers

penaltyRefIds.description: Optional. Reference to penalties applicable on this offer

augRefIds.description:
Optional. Additional arbitrary data relating to offers that the API consumers are not expected to process.
They embed opaque data required for subsequent pricing and conversion of the offer into order. API consumers
must relay all `Augmentation`s referred in the offer they select in subsequent pricing call
Key is `aug_id` and value the corresponding `Struct` type data.

offerChangedOffer.description: A proposal to sell a specific set of products or services under specific conditions, for a certain price.

differentialTypeCode.description: Optional. Several types of action are possible when the customer selects a reshopped offer - e.g. additional collection or refund

diff.description:
Required. Details of difference in Price and FareDetails in the new reshopped offer compared to original offer
`fare_details` will be set if airline provides differential amounts in fare details

new.description:
Required. Price and FareDetails of new re-shopped offer
`fare_details` will be set if airline provides new/actual amounts in fare details

penaltyRefId.description: Optional. Reference to Change Fee at OfferItem level. Note: There can be carriers which do not provide penalty in FareDetail.

offerDifferentialPriceAndFareDetails.description:
For each offer item, this function allows the airline to inform the seller about amount to be paid based on the
difference between current and newly re-shopped itinerary.

offerDifferentialTypeCode.description:
Enumeration of Price Differential Type Code
 - DIFFERENTIAL_TYPE_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: Default
 - ADD_COL: Additional collection i.e. due amount is more than 0
the change will result into a new payment from the customer (applies to change scenarios)
 - ADD_COL_AND_REFUND: the change will result into both a new payment from customer and a customer refund (applies to cancellation and change scenarios)
 - ADD_COL_AND_RESIDUAL: the change will result into both a new payment from customer and a determined amount kept by airline for future use
(applies to cancellation and change scenarios)
 - EVEN_EXCHANGE: No addition collection i.e. due amount is 0
the change does not have any financial impact to the customer (applies to change scenarios)
 - REFUND: due amount is negative
the change will result into a customer refund (applies to cancellation and change scenarios)
 - RESIDUAL: the change will result into a determined amount kept by airline for future use (applies to cancellation and change scenarios)
 - REUSABLE: the financial result of the change will be determined when customer will come back to select new journey options
(applies to change scenarios when customer does not yet know how to reuse his money)

fareTypeCodes.description: Optional. Fare type preferences. E.g. Agency Private fare, Marine fare etc.

offerFareCriteria.description: Fare criteria used to filter shopping results.

bestOfferRefId.description:
The Offer ID of the _best_ offer on a flight or flights combination
determined based on `com.verteil.air.offer.shop.v3.ResponseControls.sort_order`.

otherOfferRefIds.description:
Offer IDs of all other offers on the same flight or flights combination.
The ordering of Offer IDs is based on `com.verteil.air.offer.shop.v3.ResponseControls.sort_order`.

offerFlightOffersGroup.description:
Container for grouping offers based on flight or flights combination
(corresponding to a PaxJourney for one way shopping or PaxJourney combination for return shopping).
This is intended for displaying  flight wise offers in shopping results page.

originDestinationsCriteria.description: Required. A container for a flight request type which allow multiple Origin and Destination flight criteria to be provided.

specificOriginDestinations.description:
Required. A container for a flight request type which allow multiple specified origin and destinations to be provided.
This can be used to initiate targeted search, e.g. BOM-SIN on SQ421 on 25Feb on K RBD connecting to SIN-SFO on SQ322 on 26Feb on K RBD

offerFlightRequest.description:
Flight Request Choice of Affinity, Origin Destination or Journey flight information for this shopping request.
Currently only `origin_destinations_criteria` based shopping request is supported.

paxJourneyRefId.description: Required. References to a pax journey

priceClassRefId.description: Required. Reference to a price class

paxJourneyRefs.description: Required. A collection of flight segments which satisfies transportation of a passenger for a given origin and destination.

seatAssignment.description:
Required. The Seat Location selected by the Passenger (via SeatAvailability)
or assigned to the Passenger by the Airline for a given segment.
When used, only a single Passenger must be referenced within the Service.

serviceDefRef.description:
Required. Airline specific definition of a product or service (excluding flights) that can be separately sold and delivered.

offerOrderRepriceRQ.description:
The OrderReshop transaction set passes new shopping requests to an airline to replace existing specified order or order items in an Order or for new shopping requests to add to an existing Order. Airline responds with product offers within the context of the existing Order.
There is no change to the Order or Order Items, in response to a Reshop request - typically, the Reshop response will be followed by an OrderChangeRQ or OrderCancelRQ transaction, to commit the re-shop offer.
In the response, the Airline can provide exact instructions as to what actions can finally be executed, as a solution to the initially requested action.

sortOrder.description:
Optional. The sorting order of offers.
If provided, the sorting will be done based based on the first sort control, then with the second to break ties,
then with third to break ties and so on.

If not provided, the default sort order will be [`PRICE`, `STOPS`, `DEPARTURE_TIME`]

resultsLimit.description:
Optional. The maximum number of offers that should be returned.
If provided, only top results_limit offers after sorting based on sort_order will be returned.
If not provided the system limit of 800 offers will apply.
If provided, `result_limit` cannot be more than system limit.

resultPreference.description: Optional. Allows fine tuning of the offers that get returned when `result_limit` is applied.

offerResponseControls.description: Guidance on how the response should be returned - sorting, maximum number of results etc.

offerResultPreference.description:
Enumeration of shopping result preference that allows fine tuning of the offers that get returned when
`ResponseControls.result_limit` is applied.

 - OPTIMIZED: Default. The offers returned tries to meet the following objectives in their order of importance:
1. Provide best offer as per `ResponseControls.sort_order` on every onward and return flight combination.
2. Provide all offers with same price class on onward and return for each flight combination, working from top of the best offer list
   If same price class is not available on onward and return, the next available best price class combination is returned.
The objective is to first try and include all flight options in the result, and then try to include all price class
options available on those flights with top flight combinations getting higher preference.
 - BEST: Only the best offer as per `ResponseControls.sort_order` on every onward and return flight combination is returned.
 - FULL: All offers are to be returned.
Note that a shopping response will not have more than `ResponseControls.results_limit` offers. Consequently sorted
offers that are below the result_limit will be dropped.
The primary intention is to *NOT* miss any flight combination, so a certain number of flight combinations will have all possible
offers, but certain flight combinations will not have anything more than one.
For example, if the `ResponseControls.results_limit` is provided as 400 and if there are 500 offers returned by the supplier
with 300 unique flight combinations, then we will guarantee that offers returned will have all the 300 unique flight combinations.
The remaining 100 out of provided limit 400 will be filled in the topmost flight combinations.

orderUpdateOrderItemsRQ.description:
Request used by the seller to request the airline to commit changes to an existing Order
by adding, removing or replacing Order Items (with potential refund conditions, in case of cancellations).
The actions possible are determined by the airline and communicated to the seller via `OrderReshop` and `OrderRequote`
APIs (which precedes `UpdateOrderItems`). It is up to the seller to then accept the proposed actions from the
`OrderRequoteRS` by echoing these functions in this order servicing structure

addRemarks.description: The list of remarks which are to be added against the order.

orderUpdateOrderRemarks.description: The remarks to be updated for the given order.

deleteTags.description: The list of keys of the tags which are to be removed from the system for a particular order.

addTags.description:
The tags which are to be added to the system for a particular order.
The maximum length of a tag key is 125 characters.
The maximum length of a tag value is 255 characters.

editTags.description:
The tags which are to be edited for a particular order.
The maximum length of a tag key is 125 characters.
The maximum length of a tag value is 255 characters.

orderUpdateOrderTags.description:
The tags which can be used provides users with the ability to associate additional information with their orders by using searchable tags, which are essentially key-value pairs.
These tags can be meaningful descriptors that help users categorize and identify orders more efficiently.

ownerCode.description: Required. Supplier identifier. For air content, this is IATA-defined 2-character code of the carrier owning the service

orderId.description: Required. Reference to existing Order being changed.

channel.description:
Optional. The channel though which this order is created and managed.
If not provided, default 'NDC' channel applies.

party.description:
Optional. A party is an individual, a group, or a body having a role in the transaction.
E.g. a corporation that can have special deals with different carriers

passengerServicing.description: Function to Add, Remove or Update the Passenger Details. Providing the New and Previous values together implies an Update.

augmentations.description: Optional. Additional arbitrary data relating to offers that the API consumers are not expected to process.

orderUpdatePaxRQ.description: Request used by the seller to request the airline to commit changes to an existing passenger

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

currencyCode.description: Required. The 3-letter currency code defined in ISO 4217.

units.description:
Optional. The whole units of the amount.
For example if `currencyCode` is `"USD"`, then 1 unit is one US dollar.

nanos.description:
Optional. Number of nano (10^-9) units of the amount.
The value must be between -999,999,999 and +999,999,999 inclusive.
If `units` is positive, `nanos` must be positive or zero.
If `units` is zero, `nanos` can be positive, zero, or negative.
If `units` is negative, `nanos` must be negative or zero.
For example $-1.75 is represented as `units`=-1 and `nanos`=-750,000,000.

typeMoney.description: Represents an amount of money with its currency type. When the money value is "Zero" the response will only have currency code.
